node.title: Ford recalls 250,000 heavy-duty pickups for drive shaft fractures
node.description: Nearly 250,000 heavy-duty pickup trucks are recalled because their drive shafts can fracture and cause a loss of power.

node.title: Biden unveils new sanctions on Russia for "premeditated attack" on Ukraine
node.description: "Putin is the aggressor. Putin chose this war. And now he and his country will bear the consequences," Mr. Biden said."

node.title: Bledisloe Cup series reduced to two matches
node.description: The annual three-match Bledisloe Cup series between the All Blacks and Wallabies will be scaled back to two tests until at least 2025.

node.title: Omicron phase three: What you need to know
node.description: Explainer - The government has announced the country is moving to phase three - but what does that mean? RNZ is here to clear it all up.

node.title: NZ sharemarket slumps in response to Ukraine invasion
node.description: The local sharemarket has slumped to a two year low and the New Zealand dollar fallen on reports of Russian military action in Ukraine.

node.title: After five years and five attempts, Quade Cooper gets Australian citizenship
node.description: Wallabies first-five Quade Cooper received his Australian citizenship after five years and five attempts and having played 75 tests.

node.title: Rep. Michael McCaul on Russia-Ukraine crisis
node.description: President Biden has made it clear he will not send any U.S. troops into Ukraine.

node.title: Over half of U.S. abortions now done with pills, not surgery
node.description: More than half of U.S. abortions are now done with pills rather than surgery, an upward trend that spiked during the pandemic with the increase in telemedicine, a new report shows.

node.title: UEFA could move Champions League final from Russia
node.description: UEFA will move this year's Champions League final from St Petersburg in the wake of Russia's invasion of Ukraine.

node.title: Trump's response to Putin's invasion of Ukraine reveals GOP fissures
node.description: Republicans split on how much the U.S. should be involved in the conflict.

node.title: Nine-a-side possible at Cricket World Cup
node.description: Teams at next month's Women's Cricket World Cup in New Zealand will be able to field a side with only nine players if their squad is affected by Covid-19.

node.title: Russia attacked Ukraine with 100 missiles, 75 bombers, official says
node.description: The initial Russian barrage included ballistic, cruise and surface-to-air missiles, the U.S. official said.

node.title: Russian troops trying to seize Chernobyl nuclear plant, says Ukraine's president
node.description: "Our defenders are giving their lives so that the tragedy of 1986 will not be repeated," Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky tweeted.

node.title: India get one back against White Ferns
node.description: Another top knock from Amelia Kerr was not enough for the White Ferns to complete a clean sweep of the ODI series against India in Queenstown.

node.title: Number of Americans collecting jobless aid falls to lowest level since 1970
node.description: As the Omicron wave recedes, fewer people are being laid off and more who are unemployed are finding new jobs.

node.title: World reacts to 'full-scale invasion of Ukraine' by Russia
node.description: Russia says it feels a 'constant threat from the territory of modern Ukraine' as it sent missiles and troops into the country sending shockwaves around the world.

node.title: 'Familiarity with athletes breeds compromise'
node.description: Opinion - Sports writers' fondness for athletes compromises their ability to truly serve their audience, Hamish Bidwell writes.

node.title: Tall Blacks on road to world cup
node.description: The Tall Blacks are back on court after a year in the international basketball wilderness.

node.title: Ukrainian teen recounts the moment she woke up to war
node.description: Yesterday, 15-year-old Daniele spoke of music, movies and plans for a school dance. Today, she woke up to the sound of explosions as Russia attacked her city.

node.title: How Ukraine's armed forces shape up against Russia's
node.description: Ukraine's armed forces are heavily outnumbered and outgunned by Russia's, but military experts say they would be capable of mounting significant resistance and inflicting heavy casualties.

node.title: Mayor dismisses councillor from meeting for breaching council rules
node.description: A Kaipara District councillor was temporarily ejected from the council's first 2022 meeting for contempt of council.

node.title: World leaders condemn Russian invasion of Ukraine
node.description: The conflict threatens to be Europe's largest land war in more than 75 years.

node.title: Here's where Afghan evacuees have resettled in the U.S.
node.description: More than one-third of 67,380 Afghans processed at U.S. military sites following their evacuation from Afghanistan have been resettled in Texas, California and Virginia.

node.title: Putin attacks Ukraine after months promising no plans to do so
node.description: Now the Russian leader says his plans "do not include an occupation," but with missiles falling and forces reportedly crossing the border, he's hard to trust.

node.title: Watch Live: Biden to address "unjustified" Russian attack on Ukraine
node.description: The president is set to deliver remarks after meeting with world leaders and his National Security Council.

node.title: 80% of rental assistance was given to very low-income families
node.description: Many of the recipients were people of color and women.

node.title: Ukrainian exchange student in U.S. describes parents' reaction to invasion
node.description: An exchange student in Dallas said her parents told her they had not heard any gunfire yet and were planning to leave Thursday.

node.title: Some 1.7 million newer Hondas probed for needless automatic braking
node.description: Federal officials say they've got 278 complaints involving 2017 through 2019 CR-V SUVs and 2018 and 2019 Accord sedans. The problem could make them vulnerable to rear collisions.

node.title: COVID infection increases risk of dangerous heart problems, study finds
node.description: Problems include stroke, heart attack, myocarditis and irregular heart rhythms, according to the study.

node.title: Most don't see enough Black representation in corporate America
node.description: Large majorities of Black people say they don't have enough representation, while White people divide along party lines on this question.
